ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Re: Proxy: Connection refused problem - authentication
ygData.msgSnippet: While its possible to load credentials into Heritrix so it can pass authentications when challenged (Basic Auth, etc.), we don t provide a means of supplying

X-Yahoo-Profile: stackarchiveorg

While its possible to load credentials into Heritrix so it can pass 
authentications when challenged (Basic Auth, etc.), we don't provide a 
means of supplying credentials to pass an HTTP proxy.  Our HTTP lib, 
commons httpclient, support this: See 
http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/httpclient/authentication.html#Proxy_Authentication.   


One approach would duplicate the section for filling in credentials so 
it also sits under the proxy settings in our FetchHTTP processor.

If you'd like to make a patch, we'll apply it.

St.Ack


tintangsg wrote:
>
> Hi,
> Thanks Laurence and Gordon, I've changed the proxy to IP address and
> don't get the connection refused error anymore. However, there is a
> new error as follows:
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector AuthenticationNeeded
> INFO: Authentication requested but doAuthentication is disabled
>
> There must be somewhere in the order.xml where I can set the
> authentication name and password or something similar. Can anyone
> please tell me the use of the following in the HTTP header and how
> to use them?
> - WWW-Authenticate
> - Proxy-Authenticate
> - Proxy-Authorization
>
> Best of all, how to get Heritrix to pass proxy authentication given
> that the proxy host IP and port is already specified?
>
> Cheers,
> Tim
>
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
> <mailto:archive-crawler%40yahoogroups.com>, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>
> wrote:
> >
> > tintangsg wrote:
> > > Hi,
> > > Please read on and give me some suggestions!
> > >
> > > My crawler seems to be able to crawl webpages on my local
> machine but
> > > not go out to the Internet. I received the following error:
> > >
> > > INFO: I/O exception caught when processing request: Connection
> refused:
> > > connect
> > > org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector
> > > executeWithRetry
> > >
> > > I've tried the following in my program:
> > > System.setProperty("http.proxyHost", "<proxy>");
> > > System.setProperty("http.proxyPort", "<port>");
> > >
> > > where <proxy> is the proxy of my company and <port> is the proxy
> port.
> > >
> > > However, it doesn't seem to work yet.
> >
> > As Laurian suggested, specifying the proxy host as an IP address
> may help.
> >
> > Do the exact same host (by IP) and port work if entered as proxy
> > settings in your web browser?
> >
> > > May this be due to authentication problem (where you have to
> enter
> > > user name and password)? I've tried to encode the string =
> > > username:password using base 64 and put it in the "Proxy-
> > > Authorization" field in the HTTP header in the order.xml file as
> > > follows:
> > >
> > > <map name="http-headers">
> > > <string name="Proxy-
> Authorization">dGYhhtdDp0bGGGGGwM==</string>
> > >
> > > but it still doesn't work.
> >
> > I'm not familiar with proxy-authorization practices, so I don't
> know if
> > this could be your problem or your added header could possibly
> help. Sorry.
> >
> > - Gordon @ IA
> >
>
>
